pli-tv-bu-vb-sk44:2.1: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk44:5.1: 44. The training rule on lifted balls of food
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk44:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk44:6.2: At that time the monks from the group of six ate from lifted balls of food. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk44:7.1: “‘I will not eat from a lifted ball of food,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk44:8.1: One should not eat from a lifted ball of food.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk44:8.2: If a monk out of disrespect eats from a lifted ball of food, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk44:9.2: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk44:10.1: The fourth training rule is finished.
